p: Our findings suggest that other cities at risk for heat-related mortality in South Asia may benefit from Ahmedabad's example. The national government in India has created guidance based on the Ahmedabad HAP [ 46] and has worked to scale up heat early warning systems and action plans to 11 states and 30 cities in India, with several new HAPs being developed or now in place [ 47]. The Ahmedabad HAP, as well as the Indian government's scale-up effort, can serve as models for neighboring South Asian countries interested in increasing resilience to extreme heat.
